titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Conversation for Bart, Recorded by Friends of A. Bartlett Giamatti
Conversation for Bart, Recorded by Friends of A. Bartlett Giamatti Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday April 26, 2019 at 07:00

did.unittitle: Conversation for Bart, recorded by friends of A. Bartlett Giamatti

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The material consists of a sound recording of friends reminiscing about A. Bartlett Giamatti, former president of Yale.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Forms part of Yale Record Group 49 (YRG 49), Papers and projects on Yale.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: The material was a gift of Russell Goddard, 2000.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: A Conversation for Bart, Recorded by Friends of A. Bartlett Giamatti (RU 411). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Yale University records are arranged and described at the accession level by the creating office. The University Archives creates collection level descriptive records, but typically does no further arrangement and description at the accession level.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The material consists of a sound recording of friends reminiscing about A. Bartlett Giamatti, former president of Yale.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Original born digital files, as well as preservation masters, may not be accessed due to their fragility. Researchers must consult use copies, or if none exist request that they be made. Born digital files cannot be accessed remotely. System requirements include a Manuscripts and Archives computer and file viewing software.
